tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE firewall_configurations (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    firewall_name STRING,
    firewall_type STRING,
    firewall_version STRING,
    created_at TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE firewall_rules (
    rule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    rule_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    allow_access BOOL,
    port_number INT,
    source_ip VARCHAR(15)
);

CREATE TABLE firewall_rules (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    rule_name VARCHAR(255),
    source_ip VARCHAR(255),
    destination_ip VARCHAR(255),
    protocol VARCHAR(50),
    action VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE firewall_logs (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    log_time TIMESTAMP,
    log_message TEXT,
    firewall_rule_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (firewall_rule_id) REFERENCES firewall_rules(id)
);

CREATE TABLE firewall_configurations (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  description TEXT,
  created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE firewall_rules (
  rule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  configuration_id INT NOT NULL,
  rule_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  rule_description TEXT,
  rule_action VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY (configuration_id) REFERENCES firewall_configurations(id)
)

CREATE TABLE rule_users (
  user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  rule_id INT NOT NULL,
  username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  email VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  created_at TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (rule_id) REFERENCES firewall_rules(rule_id)
)

CREATE TABLE rule_logs (
  log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  rule_id INT NOT NULL,
  user_id INT NOT NULL,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
  log_description TEXT,
  FOREIGN KEY (rule_id) REFERENCES firewall_rules(rule_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES rule_users(user_id)
)

CREATE TABLE firewall_rules (
    rule_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    rule_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    protocol VARCHAR(10) NOT NULL,
    source_ip VARCHAR(15) NOT NULL,
    destination_ip VARCHAR(15) NOT NULL,
    port INTEGER NOT NULL,
    action VARCHAR(10) NOT NULL
);
